00038 //! \brief Communication interface class subclass codes
00039 //! \see usbcdc11.pdf - Section 4.3 - Table 16
00040 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

00042 {

00049     CDC_ATM_NETWORKING_CONTROL_MODEL        = 0x07
00050 };

00081 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00082 //! \brief CDC class-specific request codes
00083 //! \details Values of the bRequest field for the various class-specific requests defined 
00084 //! in the CDC specification.
00085 //! \see usbcdc11.pdf - Section 6.2 - Table 45
00086 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00087 enum
00088 {
00089     CDC_SEND_ENCAPSULATED_COMMAND       = 0x00,
00090     CDC_GET_ENCAPSULATED_COMMAND        = 0x01,
00091     CDC_SET_COMM_FEATURE                = 0x02,
00092     CDC_GET_COMM_FEATURE                = 0x03,
00093     CDC_CLEAR_COMM_FEATURE              = 0x04,
00094     CDC_SET_AUX_LINE_STATE              = 0x10,
00095     CDC_SET_HOOK_STATE                  = 0x11,
00096     CDC_PULSE_SETUP                     = 0x12,
00097     CDC_SEND_PULSE                      = 0x13,
00098     CDC_SET_PULSE_TIME                  = 0x14,
00099     CDC_RING_AUX_JACK                   = 0x15,
00100     CDC_SET_LINE_CODING                 = 0x20,
00101     CDC_GET_LINE_CODING                 = 0x21,
00102     CDC_SET_CONTROL_LINE_STATE          = 0x22,
00103     CDC_SEND_BREAK                      = 0x23,
00104     CDC_SET_RINGER_PARMS                = 0x30,
00105     CDC_GET_RINGER_PARMS                = 0x31,
00106     CDC_SET_OPERATION_PARMS             = 0x32,
00107     CDC_GET_OPERATION_PARMS             = 0x33,
00108     CDC_SET_LINE_PARMS                  = 0x34,
00109     CDC_GET_LINE_PARMS                  = 0x35,
00110     CDC_DIAL_DIGITS                     = 0x36,
00111     CDC_SET_UNIT_PARAMETER              = 0x37,
00112     CDC_GET_UNIT_PARAMETER              = 0x38,
00113     CDC_CLEAR_UNIT_PARAMETER            = 0x39,
00114     CDC_GET_PROFILE                     = 0x3A,
00115     CDC_SET_ETHERNET_MULTICAST_FILTERS  = 0x40,
00116     CDC_SET_ETHERNET_PMP_FILTER         = 0x41,
00117     CDC_GET_ETHERNET_PMP_FILTER         = 0x42,
00118     CDC_SET_ETHERNET_PACKET_FILTER      = 0x43,
00119     CDC_GET_ETHERNET_STATISTIC          = 0x44,
00120     CDC_SET_ATM_DATA_FORMAT             = 0x50,
00121     CDC_GET_ATM_DEVICE_STATISTICS       = 0x51,
00122     CDC_SET_ATM_DEFAULT_VC              = 0x52,
00123     CDC_GET_ATM_VC_STATISTICS           = 0x53
00124 };

00165 enum
00166 {
00167     CDC_DTE_PRESENT                     = (1 << 0),
00168     CDC_ACTIVATE_CARRIER                = (1 << 1)
00169 };

00176 {

00178     CDC_SERIAL_STATE_PARITY             = (1 << 5),
00179     CDC_SERIAL_STATE_FRAMING            = (1 << 4),
00180     CDC_SERIAL_STATE_RING               = (1 << 3),
00181     CDC_SERIAL_STATE_BREAK              = (1 << 2),
00182     CDC_SERIAL_STATE_TX_CARRIER         = (1 << 1),
00183     CDC_SERIAL_STATE_RX_CARRIER         = (1 << 0)
00184 };

00196 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00197 //       Structures
00198 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00199 
00200 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00201 //! \brief   Header functional descriptor
00202 //! \details This header must precede any list of class-specific descriptors.
00203 //! \see     usbcdc11.pdf - Section 5.2.3.1
00204 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00205 struct S_cdc_header_descriptor
00206 {
00207     uchar  bFunctionLength;    //!< Size of this descriptor in bytes
00208     uchar  bDescriptorType;    //!< CS_INTERFACE descriptor type
00209     uchar  bDescriptorSubtype; //!< Header functional descriptor subtype
00210     ushort bcdCDC;             //!< USB CDC specification release version
00211 
00212 } ATTR_PACKED;
00213 
00214 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00215 //! \brief   Call management functional descriptor
00216 //! \details Describes the processing of calls for the communication class
00217 //!          interface.
00218 //! \see     usbcdc11.pdf - Section 5.2.3.2
00219 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00220 struct S_cdc_call_management_descriptor
00221 {
00222     uchar bFunctionLength;    //!< Size of this descriptor in bytes
00223     uchar bDescriptorType;    //!< CS_INTERFACE descriptor type
00224     uchar bDescriptorSubtype; //!< Call management functional descriptor subtype
00225     uchar bmCapabilities;     //!< The capabilities that this configuration supports
00226     uchar bDataInterface;     //!< Interface number of the data class interface used
00227                               //!< for call management (optional)
00228 } ATTR_PACKED;
00229 
00230 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00231 //! \brief   Abstract control management functional descriptor
00232 //! \details Describes the command supported by the communication interface class
00233 //!          with the Abstract Control Model subclass code.
00234 //! \see     usbcdc11.pdf - Section 5.2.3.3
00235 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00236 struct S_cdc_abstract_control_management_descriptor
00237 {
00238     uchar bFunctionLength;    //!< Size of this descriptor in bytes
00239     uchar bDescriptorType;    //!< CS_INTERFACE descriptor type
00240     uchar bDescriptorSubtype; //!< Abstract control management functional
00241                               //!< descriptor subtype
00242     uchar bmCapabilities;     //!< Capabilities supported by this configuration
00243 
00244 } ATTR_PACKED;
00245 
00246 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00247 //! \brief   Union functional descriptors
00248 //! \details Describes the relationship between a group of interfaces that can
00249 //!          be considered to form a functional unit.
00250 //! \see     usbcdc11.pdf - Section 5.2.3.8
00251 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00252 struct S_cdc_union_descriptor
00253 {
00254     uchar bFunctionLength;    //!< Size of this descriptor in bytes
00255     uchar bDescriptorType;    //!< CS_INTERFACE descriptor type
00256     uchar bDescriptorSubtype; //!< Union functional descriptor subtype
00257     uchar bMasterInterface;   //!< The interface number designated as master
00258 
00259 } ATTR_PACKED;
00260 
00261 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00262 //! \brief  Union functional descriptors with one slave interface
00263 //! \see    S_cdc_union_descriptor
00264 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00265 struct S_cdc_union_1slave_descriptor
00266 {
00267     S_cdc_union_descriptor  sUnion;                 //!< Union functional descriptor
00268     uchar                   bSlaveInterfaces[ 1 ];  //!< Slave interface 0
00269 } ATTR_PACKED;
00270 
00271 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00272 //! \brief   Line coding structure
00273 //! \details Format of the data returned when a GetLineCoding request is received
00274 //! \see     usbcdc11.pdf - Section 6.2.13
00275 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00276 struct S_cdc_line_coding
00277 {
00278     uint  dwDTERate;          //! Data terminal rate in bits per second
00279     char  bCharFormat;        //! Number of stop bits
00280     char  bParityType;        //! Parity bit type
00281     char  bDataBits;          //! Number of data bits
00282 
00283 } ATTR_PACKED;

00295 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00296 enum //!< Various constants
00297 {
00298     SER_EPT_DATA_OUT      = 0x01,   //!< Address of the Bulk-OUT endpoint used by the 
00299                                     //!<   data class interface
00300     SER_EPT_DATA_IN       = 0x02,   //!< Address of the Bulk-IN endpoint used by the 
00301                                     //!<   data class interface
00302     SER_EPT_NOTIFICATION  = 0x03,   //!< Address of the Interrupt-IN notification 
00303                                     //!<   endpoint
00304     SER_VENDOR_ID         = 0x03EB, //!< ATMEL Vendor ID
00305     SER_PRODUCT_ID        = 0x6119, //!< Product ID expected by the host serial driver
00306     SER_RELEASE_NUMBER    = 0x0001  //!< Device Release Number 0.01
00307 };

00313 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00314 //! \brief  Configuration descriptor for an Abstract Control Model device.
00315 //! \see    usbcdc11.pdf - Section 3.6.2
00316 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00317 struct S_ser_configuration_descriptor
00318 {
00319     //! Standard USB configuration descriptor
00320     S_usb_configuration_descriptor                sCfg;
00321     //! Communication class interface
00322     S_usb_interface_descriptor                    sCommunication;
00323     //! Header functional descriptor
00324     S_cdc_header_descriptor                       sHeader;
00325     //! Call management functional descriptor
00326     S_cdc_call_management_descriptor              sCallManagement;
00327     //! Abstract control management functional descriptor
00328     S_cdc_abstract_control_management_descriptor  sAbstract;
00329     //! Union functional descriptor
00330     S_cdc_union_1slave_descriptor                 sUnion;
00331     //! Notification endpoint descriptor
00332     S_usb_endpoint_descriptor                     sNotification;
00333     //! Data class interface
00334     S_usb_interface_descriptor                    sData;
00335     //! Data out endpoint descriptor
00336     S_usb_endpoint_descriptor                     sDataOut;
00337     //! Data in endpoint descriptor
00338     S_usb_endpoint_descriptor                     sDataIn;
00339 
00340 } ATTR_PACKED;
00341 
00342 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00343 //! \brief  CDC class driver structure
00344 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00345 class CCDC : public CSTD
00346 {
00347     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00348     //! List of endpoints (including endpoint 0) used by the device.
00349     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00350     enum { NUM_ENDPOINTS = 4 };
00351     CEndpoint EndpointList[ NUM_ENDPOINTS ];
00352 
00353 public:    
00354     S_cdc_line_coding  sLineCoding;  //!< Contains line coding i.e. data rate,
00355                                      //!< data bit count, stop bit and parity information
00356     bool  isCarrierActivated;        //!< Indicates if the device's carrier is activated
00357     bool  isPresentDTE;              //!< Indicates if the terminal is present
00358 
00359 private:
00360     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00361     //       Internal methods
00362     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00363 
00364     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00365     //! \brief   Sets asynchronous line-character formatting properties
00366     //! \details This function is used as a callback when receiving the data part
00367     //!          of a SET_LINE_CODING request.
00368     //! \see     usbcdc11.pdf - Section 6.2.12
00369     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00370     static void OnSetLineCoding( CCDC* pThis );
00371 
00372 public:
00373     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00374     //      Public methods
00375     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00376 
00377     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00378     //! \brief   Initializes a CDC serial driver
00379     //! \details This method sets the standard descriptors of the device and the
00380     //!          default CDC configuration.
00381     //! \param   usbDriver Pointer to the CUsbDriver instance to use
00382     //! \param   eventSink Pointer to the CEventSink driver instance to use
00383     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00384     CCDC( CUsbDriver* usbDriver, CBoard* board, CEventSink* eventSink );
00385 
00386     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00387     //! \brief  SETUP request handler for an Abstract Control Model device
00388     //! \see    usbcdc11.pdf - Section 6.2
00389     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00390     void RequestHandler( void );
00391 
00392     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00393     //! \brief  Reads data from the Data OUT endpoint
00394     //! \param  pBuffer   Buffer in which to store the received data
00395     //! \param  dLength   Length of data buffer
00396     //! \param  fCallback Optional callback function
00397     //! \param  pArgument Optional parameter for the callback function
00398     //! \return SER_STATUS_SUCCESS if transfer has started successfully;
00399     //!         SER_STATUS_LOCKED if endpoint is currently in use;
00400     //!         SER_STATUS_ERROR if transfer cannot be started.
00401     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00402     EnumStandardReturnValue Read
00403     (
00404         void* pBuffer, uint dLength,
00405         Callback_f fCallback, void *pArgument 
00406         )
00407     {
00408         return pDriver->Read( SER_EPT_DATA_OUT, pBuffer, 
00409                               dLength, fCallback, pArgument );
00410     }
00411 
00412     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00413     //! \brief  Sends data through the Data IN endpoint
00414     //! \param  pBuffer   Buffer holding the data to transmit
00415     //! \param  dLength   Length of data buffer
00416     //! \param  fCallback Optional callback function
00417     //! \param  pBufferLowerBound Lower bound of the circular buffer
00418     //! \param  pBufferUpperBound Upper bound of the circular buffer
00419     //! \param  pArgument Optional parameter for the callback function
00420     //! \return SER_STATUS_SUCCESS if transfer has started successfully;
00421     //!         SER_STATUS_LOCKED if endpoint is currently in use;
00422     //!         SER_STATUS_ERROR if transfer cannot be started.
00423     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00424     EnumStandardReturnValue Write( 
00425         const void* pBuffer, uint dLength,
00426         Callback_f fCallback = 0, void* pArgument = 0,
00427         const void* pBufferLowerBound = 0, const void* pBufferUpperBound = 0
00428         )
00429     {
00430         return pDriver->Write( SER_EPT_DATA_IN, pBuffer, dLength, 
00431                                fCallback, pArgument,
00432                                pBufferLowerBound, pBufferUpperBound
00433                                );
00434     }    
00435 };
